26 Imgur Creator Spotlight: @joyousjoyfuljoyness just posted this and I think it's awesome, go have a peek and upvote ❤️
27 Man Tax: Michael B. Jordan
“A conclusion is the place where you got tired of thinking.” - Steven Wright I try to keep my posts "good vibe zones". So, instead of finding the one thing in here you don't like and commenting only on that, also comment about something you DID like. Balance the negativity. Love you long time. So, I made a discord server. It's a relaxed environment where you can take/donate memes to the cause, play trivia twice a week, chat about lots of topics or about nothing at all. We also have Jack Box game night and are setting up movie night! Very laid back/relaxed vibe. Come hang with us. https://discord.gg/AWFV7FT3RQ I'm also on the imgcat server for updates & fun: https://discord.gg/TpjD37jgJ9 ***Also if you miss abbiistabbii's discord community good news! Here's the new one https://discord.gg/NPStJGgARq - where everyone's reconnecting, shitposting, and hanging out again*** https://ko-fi.com/mememuseumcurator Unable to work, zero income. Feel free to leave me a tip. Those that have, y'all are the bee's knees. You've helped me so much. ***Tag me if you see an artist/creator you like whose work isn't getting seen as much as it should be! Or if you are an artist/creator and want me to post something of yours, DM me! All non-videos. Thanks, imgur. Fix your shit.

item.title: New Elf
item.description:
Ever fallen in love for a show or comic, only to discover it got canceled because not enough people supported it? We don't want that to happen here. The brutal truth is: creating these comics is a labor of love, but love alone doesn't pay the bills. Without financial support, even things you cherish can fade away. By joining our Patreon, you're not just getting perks – you're keeping this comic alive. If you love what we do, help ensure it doesn't disappear. Your support means everything. https://www.patreon.com/warandpeas
You can also gift the love letter on Christmas: https://www.patreon.com/warandpeas/gift
item.dc:creator: Warandpeasofficial

item.title: The Shire was a large land
item.description:
This is a lore post on the perhaps surprising size of the Shire, that the hobbits themselves knew in the Common Speech as Sûza (art by LastStudio).
In most adaptations of the Shire is seen little more than the village of Bywater, where was the inn of the Green Dragon, and the village of Hobbiton where in a hill was Bag End, home of Bilbo and Frodo Baggins, and their surrounding farmlands.
It can give the impression that the Shire was not much more than a township or a commune, when it in fact was a whole country (art by JRR Tolkien). Frodo left Bag End in year 3018 of the Third Age; in the Shire Recknoning this was year 1418, counted from when they received the territory from the Dúnedain.
Long before, at the end of the Second Age, the Dúnedain formed two kingdoms: to the south Gondor (blue), and to the north Arnor (red) in the region of Eriador. In the first fifteen centuries of the Third Age Gondor grew in might and expanded its borders. Arnor instead broke apart into petty kingdoms; their wars against each other, and Angmar in the North, had the sparse population of Eriador dwindle away.
In the 12th century of the Third Age Hobbits first crossed the Misty Mountains. They spread in western and southern Eriador that was increasingly wild and lawless. In 1601 hobbits from the area about Bree acquired permission to settle in a region (red) within the last remaining Dúnedain kingdom of Arthedain (yellow). Soon migration from the east was followed by hobbits coming up from the south.
“The land was rich and kindly, and though it had long been deserted when they entered it, it had before been well tilled, and there the king had once had many farms, cornlands, vineyards, and woods.” – The Fellowship of the Ring; Prolouge; I (art by Ted Nasmith) The halflings knew it as Sûza [Province, District] and remained there in peace after Arthedain fell in 1974. The surviving Dúnedain meanwhile chose to live on in the seclusion of the wilderness and became the first Rangers of the North.
Sûza had four administrative quarters called farthings. The word farthing is via Middle English ferthing from Old English fēorthing, fēorthung [a quarter, fourth part]. The often portrayed villages of Hobbiton and Bywater lay near the heart of the land, on the eastern edge of the Westfarthing (yellow). The other quarters were the Northfarthing (purple), the Eastfarthing (green) and the Southfarthing (blue).
The eastern border of the land consisted of the Brandywine River. This changed in 2340, seven centuries before the LotR, when hobbits settled in Buckland (brown). Buckland lay inbetween the Brandywine and the Old Forest. Though a part of the Shire it was not included in a farthing and the area was in practice governed by the head of the Brandybuck family, known as the Master of Buckland.
When Frodo began his quest in 3018 Sûza (red) was about 40 leagues (120 miles or 193 kilometers) west to east, and ca 50 leagues (150 miles or 241 km) north to south. For reference are shown Rohan (green) and Gondor (blue); though while Sûza was not small it was isolated, as the only other well-populated area in Eriador was Bree.
The area of Sûza in 3018 has been estimated to about 20,000 square miles, that is about 51,800 square kilometers. Compared to contemporary geography it would been on par with Bosnia and Herzegovina, and with Costa Rica; or nearly as large as the state of West Virginia in the USA.
As as an example on distance, from Bag end in Hobbiton to Farmer Maggot* in the Marish there was a distance of more than 50 miles (80 kilometers) as the crow flies. *In the film Frodo and Sam met Pippin and Merry raiding Maggot's crops. In the book Frodo, Sam and Pippin visited him late on the third day leaving Bag End.
This may raise the question how Sauron could be unaware of the land? Hobbits were new and irrelevant during the decline of Arnor and thereafter the Dark Lord no longer kept tabs on the seemingly empty and insignificant Eriador. Shire-hobbits seldom left their home, and the land never exercised any kind of military or even economical power on the international stage to bring attention to it.
Apparently no news were spread by those who knew about hobbits. The Dúnedain Rangers warded them from threats (FotR; II; II), the Elves had no interest in them (FotR; I; III), while the Dwarves traded for food from them but held them in no regard since they did not haggle or bought weapons (Unfinished Tales; III; III; Appendix). Not until Bilbo Baggins that is, whereafter the Dwarves instead kept the location of the Shire secret from Sauron's agents out of loyalty to Bilbo (FotR; II; II).
After the events in the LotR, in the year 31 of Fourth Age or 1452 of the Shire Reckoning, the Shire expanded though the additon of the Westmarch (orange). It was a formal gift from King Elessar (Aragorn), who restored Arnor after he became King of Gondor. Like Buckland the Westmarch lay outside the farthings. Elanor, oldest daughter of Samwise Gamgee, settled there as her husband Fastred Fairbairn was made the first Warden of Westmarch in S.R. 1462.
Some related lore accounts: Foundation of the Shire https://imgur.com/gallery/XlRuiBV Dwarves on Hobbits https://imgur.com/gallery/bezWrwd The history of Arnor https://imgur.com/gallery/I22ZCKi — — — — — For more Tolkien lore posts, enjoy these two indexes: Character bios https://imgur.com/gallery/axV2mPF Folks, events, items, etc https://imgur.com/gallery/AQK9pJL
item.dc:creator: Ngugi
